channel.title: [TUT] Basic SCAR
channel.description:
Ok this is just for Explaining how to use SCAR.
[center][b]Table Of Contents:[/b] 1. Selecting a client window 2. Using a Color Picker 3. Stop, play and pause. 4. How to make a simple script.[/center]
[i][b]1. Specifing a new client window.[/b][/i]
[center][b]Whats A Client Window?[/b] A Client window is like the runescape screen. It tells scar where to use the script.
[b]How do I get it?[/b] ((pic Below)) Open up SCAR, there is a black circle with 2 lines, one up and down, and another across. [img]http://i76.photobucket.com/albums/j18/calebchapman06/SCAR.jpg[/img]
[b]How do I use it?[/b] ((pic below)) You click it, and drag it to the Runescape screen. [img]http://i76.photobucket.com/albums/j18/calebchapman06/scar3.jpg[/img]
[b]How Will I know when its done?[/b] You know its done when Four grey lines all zoom into the screen[/center]
[center]------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[b][i]2. Using a Color Picker[/i][/b]
[center][b]What is a color picker?[/b] A color picker is a little button used to get the color and Coordinates of a certain thing.
[b]How Do I Use It?[/b] ((pic below)) It's very simple, All you have to do is Click the Color Picker. And use your mouse to click where you want to get the color/coordinates. [img]http://i76.photobucket.com/albums/j18/calebchapman06/SCAR4.jpg[/img]
[b]What is the color used for?[/b] So instead of having "clickmouse" They can have the color and that tells SCAR what to click. Like the color of a tree. That tells SCAR to click that color on a tree.
[b]What is the coordinates used for?[/b] The coordinates are X & Y, They also tell SCAR where to click. But this gives a certain spot on your screen to click.
[b]After I click the spot i want coordinates for, how do I know its done?[/b] You'll know its done when a message in the message box says "Color Picked: 356995 at (444, 655) (fake coordinates and color used.)[/center]
[center]------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[b][i]3. Stop, Play and Pause.[/i][/b]
[center][b]What are the buttons "Stop, Play and Pause?"[/b] The buttons are used to "Run Script", "Pause Script", and "Stop Script." Play-Green Triangle, Pause- 2 yellow lines, Stop-red square.
[b]Can You show me?[/b] ((pic below)) Sure! It's actually the easiest thing to do with SCAR. [img]http://i76.photobucket.com/albums/j18/calebchapman06/SCAR5.jpg[/img]
[b]How Will I know when script is in progress?[/b] When you hit play, right under your message box it says "Running Script". After you hit stop it says "Script Finished."
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[i][b]4. How to make a simple Script[/b][/i]
[b]I want to make a simple script, how do I?[/b] Assuming that you have alread downloaded SCAR, if you havent (http://www.dylock.net/scar/). Here is how to make a message appear in you message box!
[b]Step 1. "Program new;"[/b] "Program New;" Is to name your script. Lets name this simple script. So it should look like this! [code]Program simplescript;[/code] You can NEVER have a space there, or any kind of symble.
[b][Step 2. Begin and End.[/b] This is used to specify the Begining of the script, and the end of the script. alltogether the script shall look like: [code]Program SimpleScript; begin end.[/code] The "end." is the COMPLETE end of script, if there are other ends there would it would be "end;"
[b]Step 3. Add in the message.[/b] To add a message to your Message Box the code you type is "Writeln('YourMessage');" This goes right after "begin." Lets meake it say "This Is An Example For A Tutorial!" So your code should look as follows: [code]Program SimpleScript; begin writeln('This is an example for a Tutorial!'); end.[/code] Now look in your message box it should say your message. You can change the message to say ANYTHING you want. But the Apostraphes(') HAVE got to be there!
Congratz on making A Simple script!
Thanks for Looking at my TUTORIAL! :)
Please let me know if this was the least bit useful :) Also view more of my Tutorials here on moparisthebest!

item.title: [TUT] Basic SCAR
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Cabby:

Waterboy99 since you obviously dont know SCAR is written in PASCAL and not JAVA, your post here was wasteful.

Maybe yours was too. Where you too presumptive to not think he might be learning SCAR AND Java(like I and a lot of people started when they registerd here), and simply put Java instead of SCAR, like a typo?

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT] Basic SCAR
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

Ok this is just for Explaining how to use SCAR.

[center]Table Of Contents:

  1. Selecting a client window
  2. Using a Color Picker
  3. Stop, play and pause.
  4. How to make a simple script.[/center]

1. Specifing a new client window.

[center]Whats A Client Window?
A Client window is like the runescape screen. It tells scar where to use the script.

How do I get it?
((pic Below)) Open up SCAR, there is a black circle with 2 lines, one up and down, and another across.

SCAR.jpg667×582

How do I use it?
((pic below)) You click it, and drag it to the Runescape screen.

scar3.jpg800×628

How Will I know when its done?
You know its done when Four grey lines all zoom into the screen[/center]

[center]------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]

2. Using a Color Picker

[center]What is a color picker?
A color picker is a little button used to get the color and Coordinates of a certain thing.

How Do I Use It?
((pic below)) It’s very simple, All you have to do is Click the Color Picker. And use your mouse to click where you want to get the color/coordinates.

SCAR4.jpg664×578

What is the color used for?
So instead of having “clickmouse” They can have the color and that tells SCAR what to click. Like the color of a tree. That tells SCAR to click that color on a tree.

What is the coordinates used for?
The coordinates are X & Y, They also tell SCAR where to click. But this gives a certain spot on your screen to click.

After I click the spot i want coordinates for, how do I know its done?
You’ll know its done when a message in the message box says "Color Picked: 356995 at (444, 655) (fake coordinates and color used.)[/center]

[center]------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]

3. Stop, Play and Pause.

[center]What are the buttons “Stop, Play and Pause?”
The buttons are used to “Run Script”, “Pause Script”, and “Stop Script.” Play-Green Triangle, Pause- 2 yellow lines, Stop-red square.

Can You show me?
((pic below)) Sure! It’s actually the easiest thing to do with SCAR.

SCAR5.jpg664×577

How Will I know when script is in progress?
When you hit play, right under your message box it says “Running Script”. After you hit stop it says “Script Finished.”

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]

4. How to make a simple Script

I want to make a simple script, how do I?
Assuming that you have alread downloaded SCAR, if you havent (http://www.dylock.net/scar/). Here is how to make a message appear in you message box!

Step 1. “Program new;”
“Program New;” Is to name your script. Lets name this simple script. So it should look like this!

Program simplescript;

You can NEVER have a space there, or any kind of symble.

[Step 2. Begin and End.
This is used to specify the Begining of the script, and the end of the script.
alltogether the script shall look like:

Program SimpleScript; begin end.
The “end.” is the COMPLETE end of script, if there are other ends there would it would be “end;”

Step 3. Add in the message.
To add a message to your Message Box the code you type is “Writeln(‘YourMessage’);” This goes right after “begin.” Lets meake it say “This Is An Example For A Tutorial!”
So your code should look as follows:

Program SimpleScript; begin writeln('This is an example for a Tutorial!'); end.
Now look in your message box it should say your message. You can change the message to say ANYTHING you want. But the Apostraphes(’) HAVE got to be there!

Congratz on making A Simple script!

Thanks for Looking at my TUTORIAL!

Please let me know if this was the least bit useful
Also view more of my Tutorials here on moparisthebest!

Read full topic
